intro: Axinaea disrupta, commonly known as the broken axinaea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Axinaea disrupta is often found in moist, shaded environments within cloud forests.
